newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan doesn't need stimulative extra budget -- MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan doesn't need stimulative extra budget -- MOF.

text.p: There is no need for Japan to consider an extra stimulative budget at present, Vice Finance Minister Tadashi Ogawa told a news conference on Monday.

Asked about the need to formulate an extra budget for the current fiscal year, ending next March, to stimulate the economy, Ogawa said: "At present I don't think the situation warrants starting to discuss such things. At the same time, we must watch economic conditions carefully."

Japan's economy is steadily recovering, although the pace is gradual, he said. "At the moment we should smoothly implement the state budget for fiscal 1996/97 and hope the economic recovery will strengthen."
